The Land of Ultimate Bliss also has inexhaustible natural music of myriad kinds.

After AmitÃ¢bha Buddha and the bodhisattvas and arhats have all bathed, they each sit on a lotus flower, and then a natural disorderly wind arises in the four directions.
That disorderly wind is not the wind of the world, nor is it the wind of the heavens;

The chaotic wind is neither too cold nor too warm, always moderate, with incomparable coolness and pleasantness;
The chaotic wind rises slowly, neither slow nor fast, just right.
It blows on the seven-treasure trees in the country, and the seven-treasure trees all produce the five tones by themselves;
The chaotic wind blows the flowers, all covering the country.
The flowers all scatter themselves on the Buddha of Immeasurable Pure Light and the bodhisattvas and arhats.
As soon as the flowers fall on the ground, the flowers are all four inches thick, incomparably soft and beautiful.
When the flowers wither a little, the natural chaotic wind blows away the withered flowers, all naturally disappearing.
Then in the four directions, a natural chaotic wind rises again, blowing on the seven-treasure trees, and the seven-treasure trees all produce the five tones again;
The chaotic wind blows the flowers, and they all naturally scatter on the Buddha of Immeasurable Pure Light and the bodhisattvas and arhats.
When the flowers fall to the ground, a natural wind blows and scatters the withered flowers, all of which naturally disappear.
Then, a natural wind blows from the four directions again, blowing the flowers of the seven-jeweled trees in this way four times.

Among the bodhisattvas and arhats, some only wish to hear the sutra, some only wish to hear the sounds of music, some only wish to smell the fragrance of flowers, some do not wish to hear the sutra, some do not wish to hear the five tones, some do not wish to smell the fragrance of flowers. Those who wish to hear something will immediately hear it alone, and those who do not wish to hear something will not hear it at all. They all naturally follow their wishes, enjoying what they like, not going against what they wish for in their hearts.
